newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Chemopetrol 96 gross profit falls.
newsitem.headline: Czech Chemopetrol 96 gross profit falls.

text.p: Czech petrochemical concern Chemopetrol Group a.s. said on Tuesday its 1996 consolidated gross profit totalled 1.94 billion crowns, down from 3.93 billion in 1995.
Chemopetrol said in a statement that its operational profit for 1996 was 1.165 billion crowns on revenues of 16.964 billion crowns.
The company had predicted the fall in profit after its refining operations were divested at the end of 1995 as part of the privatisation of Czech refineries.

In a deal completed last year, the consortium IOC, which consists of three foreign oil groups bought a 49 percent stake in Ceska Rafinerska, a company set up to operate the two main refineries at Litvinov and Kralupy, which earlier belonged to Chemopetrol and Kaucuk repsectively.
The IOC is equally owned by DuPont Co unit Conoco, Royal Dutch Shell, and Italy's Agip. The state holds the remaining 51 percent stake in Rafinerska through the holding company Unipetrol a.s..
The remaining parts of Kaucuk and Chemopetrol, both controlled by the state, have merged into Unipetrol with a share swap to be completed later this year.
